Source code for havoc.autoval.lib.host.connection_utils

from __future__ import absolute_import
from __future__ import division
from __future__ import print_function
from __future__ import unicode_literals

import sys
from havoc.autotest_testfiles.validation_utils.lib.autoval import AutovalUtils



[docs]class CmdResult(object):

[docs]    def __init__(self, command, stdout, stderr, return_code, duration):
        self.command = command
        self.stdout = stdout
        self.stderr = stderr
        self.return_code = return_code
        self.duration = duration


    def __str__(self):
        _this = "Command: %s rc [%d]\n" % (self.command, self.return_code)
        _this += "Output: %s\n" % (self.stdout + self.stderr)
        return _this




[docs]class ConnectionUtils(object):

[docs]    @classmethod
    def log_cmdlog(cls, hostname, cmd, return_code, output, custom_logfile=None):
        if custom_logfile:
            AutovalUtils.log_cmdlog(
                "[%s][%s] Exit: %d\n" % (hostname, cmd, return_code),
                custom_logfile=custom_logfile,
                custom_logout=output,
            )
        else:
            AutovalUtils.log_cmdlog(
                "[%s][%s] Exit: %d\n%s" % (hostname, cmd, return_code, output)
            )



[docs]    @classmethod
    def str_encode(cls, content):
        if isinstance(content, bytes):
            if sys.version_info[0] < 3:
                content = content.decode("ascii", "ignore")
            else:
                content = str(content, encoding='utf-8', errors='replace')
        if sys.version_info[0] < 3:
            return content.encode("ascii", "ignore")

        return content
